intro: Knautia involucrata, commonly known as the narrowleaf knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Knautia involucrata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
